Detailed Description

Settings generator.

Used in the NanoFIP design.
The Settings unit generates the constants used inside the design. Some inputs are directly taken over from the input pins as they don't need any treatment.

SEE mitigation techniques used:

  • mostly combinatiorial logic
  • registered constructor and model id regenerated on request

Author:
Erik van der Bij (Erik.van.der.Bij@cern.ch)

Definition at line 63 of file settings.vhd.

Member Data Documentation

c_id_i in std_logic_vector ( 3 downto 0 ) [Port]

Constructor identification settings.

Identification variable settings. Connect the ID inputs either to Gnd, Vcc, S_ID[0] or S_ID[1] to obtain different values for the Model data (i=0,1,2,3).
C_ID[i] connected to: Gnd S_ID0 SID1 Vcc
Constructor[2*i] 0 1 0 1
Constructor[2*i+1] 0 0 1 1

Definition at line 105 of file settings.vhd.

m_id_i in std_logic_vector ( 3 downto 0 ) [Port]

Model identification settings.

Identification variable settings. Connect the ID inputs either to Gnd, Vcc, S_ID[0] or S_ID[1] to obtain different values for the Model data (i=0,1,2,3).
M_ID[i] connected to: Gnd S_ID0 SID1 Vcc
Model [2*i] 0 1 0 1
Model [2*i+1] 0 0 1 1

Definition at line 97 of file settings.vhd.

nostat_i in std_logic [Port]

No NanoFIP status transmission.

No NanoFIP status transmission If connected to Vcc, disables sending of NanoFIP status together with the produced data.

Definition at line 128 of file settings.vhd.

p3_lgth_i in std_logic_vector ( 2 downto 0 ) [Port]

Produced variable data length.

Produced variable data length
000: 2 Bytes
001: 8 Bytes
010: 16 Bytes
011: 32 Bytes
100: 64 Bytes
101: 124 Bytes
110: reserved, do not use
111: reserved, do not use
Actual size: +1 NanoFIP Status byte +1 MPS Status byte (last transmitted) Note: when SLONE=Vcc, p3_lgth_i should be set to 000.

Definition at line 118 of file settings.vhd.

rate_i in std_logic_vector ( 1 downto 0 ) [Port]

Bit rate.

Bit rate
00: 31.25 kbit/s
01: 1 Mbit/s
10: 2.5 Mbit/s
11: reserved, do not use

Definition at line 83 of file settings.vhd.

req_id in std_logic [Port]

Request generation of Model and Constructor ID.

When high, will refresh settings_model/const_id within two clock cycles

Definition at line 135 of file settings.vhd.

Identification selection.

Identification selection (see M_ID, C_ID)

Definition at line 89 of file settings.vhd.

settings_const_id out std_logic_vector ( 7 downto 0 ) [Port]

Constructor identification.

Constructor Identification. Second byte. First byte is not settable. Used for production of Identification Variable (10xyh).

Definition at line 151 of file settings.vhd.

settings_model_id out std_logic_vector ( 7 downto 0 ) [Port]

Model identification.

Model Identification. First byte. Second byte is not settable. Used for production of Identification Variable (10xyh).

Definition at line 147 of file settings.vhd.

settings_nostat out std_logic [Port]

No NanoFIP status transmission.

No NanoFIP status transmission when 1. Straight copy of input pin (allows for further treatment if needed).

Definition at line 178 of file settings.vhd.

settings_p3_lgth out std_logic_vector ( 7 downto 0 ) [Port]

# of bytes incl status

Produced variable data length, based on p3_lgth_i and nostat_i inputs.
Outputs the number of data bytes, including the NanoFIP status and the MPS Status and can be used as the second byte sent and for variable length counting purposes.
p3_lgth nostat=0 nostat=1
000: 2 Bytes => 4 3
001: 8 Bytes => 10 9
010: 16 Bytes => 18 17
011: 32 Bytes => 34 33
100: 64 Bytes => 66 65
101: 124 Bytes => 126 125
110: reserved => 126 125 do not use - mapped onto 101
111: reserved => 126 125 do not use - mapped onto 111
Note: when SLONE=Vcc, p3_lgth_i should be set to 000.

Definition at line 168 of file settings.vhd.

Bit rate.

Bit rate. Straight copy of input pins (allows for further treatment if needed).

Definition at line 139 of file settings.vhd.

settings_slone out std_logic [Port]

Stand-alone mode.

Stand-alone mode. If connected to Vcc, disables sending of NanoFIP status together with the produced data.
Straight copy of input pin (allows for further treatment if needed).

Subscriber number. Station address. Straight copy of input pins (allows for further treatment if needed).
